trans-unit.source: Create and upload a FreeBSD VHD to Azure
trans-unit.target: Create and upload a FreeBSD VHD to Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn to create and upload an Azure virtual hard disk (VHD) that contains the FreeBSD operating system
trans-unit.target: Learn to create and upload an Azure virtual hard disk (VHD) that contains the FreeBSD operating system

trans-unit.source: Create and Upload a FreeBSD VHD to Azure
trans-unit.target: Create and Upload a FreeBSD VHD to Azure

trans-unit.source: This article shows you how to create and upload a virtual hard disk (VHD) that contains the FreeBSD operating system so you can use it as your own image to create a virtual machine (VM) in Azure.
trans-unit.target: This article shows you how to create and upload a virtual hard disk (VHD) that contains the FreeBSD operating system so you can use it as your own image to create a virtual machine (VM) in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: This article assumes that you have the following items:
trans-unit.target: This article assumes that you have the following items:

trans-unit.source: **An Azure subscription** - If you don't have one, you can create an account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: **An Azure subscription** - If you don't have one, you can create an account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: If you have an MSDN subscription, see [Azure Benefit for MSDN Subscribers](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/member-offers/msdn-benefits-details/).
trans-unit.target: If you have an MSDN subscription, see [Azure Benefit for MSDN Subscribers](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/member-offers/msdn-benefits-details/).

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, see [create a free trial account](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, see [create a free trial account](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).

trans-unit.source: **Azure PowerShell tools** - You have the Microsoft Azure PowerShell module installed and configured to use your subscription.
trans-unit.target: **Azure PowerShell tools** - You have the Microsoft Azure PowerShell module installed and configured to use your subscription.

trans-unit.source: To download the module, see [Azure Downloads](http://azure.microsoft.com/downloads/).
trans-unit.target: To download the module, see [Azure Downloads](http://azure.microsoft.com/downloads/).

trans-unit.source: A tutorial to install and configure the module is available here.
trans-unit.target: A tutorial to install and configure the module is available here.

trans-unit.source: You'll use the [Azure Downloads](http://azure.microsoft.com/downloads/) cmdlet to upload the VHD.
trans-unit.target: You'll use the [Azure Downloads](http://azure.microsoft.com/downloads/) cmdlet to upload the VHD.

trans-unit.source: **FreeBSD operating system installed in a .vhd file** - You have installed a supported FreeBSD operating system to a virtual hard disk.
trans-unit.target: **FreeBSD operating system installed in a .vhd file** - You have installed a supported FreeBSD operating system to a virtual hard disk.

trans-unit.source: Multiple tools exist to create .vhd files, for example you can use a virtualization solution such as Hyper-V to create the .vhd file and install the operating system.
trans-unit.target: Multiple tools exist to create .vhd files, for example you can use a virtualization solution such as Hyper-V to create the .vhd file and install the operating system.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see [Install the Hyper-V Role and Configure a Virtual Machine](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh846766.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see [Install the Hyper-V Role and Configure a Virtual Machine](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh846766.aspx).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The newer VHDX format is not supported in Azure.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The newer VHDX format is not supported in Azure.

trans-unit.source: You can convert the disk to VHD format using Hyper-V Manager or the cmdlet [convert-vhd](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh848454.aspx).
trans-unit.target: You can convert the disk to VHD format using Hyper-V Manager or the cmdlet [convert-vhd](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh848454.aspx).

trans-unit.source: This task includes the following five steps.
trans-unit.target: This task includes the following five steps.

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Prepare the image to be uploaded
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Prepare the image to be uploaded

trans-unit.source: As for FreeBSD installation on Hyper-v, a tutorial is available [here](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/kylie/archive/2014/12/25/running-freebsd-on-hyper-v.aspx).
trans-unit.target: As for FreeBSD installation on Hyper-v, a tutorial is available [here](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/kylie/archive/2014/12/25/running-freebsd-on-hyper-v.aspx).

trans-unit.source: From the virtual machine that the FreeBSD operating system was installed to, complete the following procedures:
trans-unit.target: From the virtual machine that the FreeBSD operating system was installed to, complete the following procedures:

trans-unit.source: Enable DHCP
trans-unit.target: Enable DHCP

trans-unit.source: Enable SSH
trans-unit.target: Enable SSH

trans-unit.source: SSH is enabled by default after installation from disc.
trans-unit.target: SSH is enabled by default after installation from disc.

trans-unit.source: If not or if you use FreeBSD VHD directly, type:
trans-unit.target: If not or if you use FreeBSD VHD directly, type:

trans-unit.source: Setup serial console
trans-unit.target: Setup serial console

trans-unit.source: Install sudo
trans-unit.target: Install sudo

trans-unit.source: The root account is disabled in Azure and then you need to utilize sudo from an unprivileged user to run commands with elevated privileges.
trans-unit.target: The root account is disabled in Azure and then you need to utilize sudo from an unprivileged user to run commands with elevated privileges.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites for Azure Agent
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites for Azure Agent

trans-unit.source: 5.1 **Install python**
trans-unit.target: 5.1 **Install python**

trans-unit.source: 5.2 **Install wget**
trans-unit.target: 5.2 **Install wget**

trans-unit.source: Install Azure Agent
trans-unit.target: Install Azure Agent

trans-unit.source: The latest release of the Azure Agent can always be found on [github](https://github.com/Azure/WALinuxAgent/releases).
trans-unit.target: The latest release of the Azure Agent can always be found on [github](https://github.com/Azure/WALinuxAgent/releases).

trans-unit.source: Version 2.0.10 and later officially supports FreeBSD 10 and later releases.
trans-unit.target: Version 2.0.10 and later officially supports FreeBSD 10 and later releases.

trans-unit.source: **Important**: After installation, please double check it is running.
trans-unit.target: **Important**: After installation, please double check it is running.

trans-unit.source: Now you could **shut down** your VM.
trans-unit.target: Now you could **shut down** your VM.

trans-unit.source: You also could execute step 7 before shut down but it is optional.
trans-unit.target: You also could execute step 7 before shut down but it is optional.

trans-unit.source: De-provision is optional.
trans-unit.target: De-provision is optional.

trans-unit.source: It is to clean the system and make it suitable for re-provisioning.
trans-unit.target: It is to clean the system and make it suitable for re-provisioning.

trans-unit.source: Below command also deletes the last provisioned user account and associated data.
trans-unit.target: Below command also deletes the last provisioned user account and associated data.

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Create a storage account in Azure
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Create a storage account in Azure

trans-unit.source: You need a storage account in Azure to upload a .vhd file so it can be used in Azure to create a virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: You need a storage account in Azure to upload a .vhd file so it can be used in Azure to create a virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: You can use the Azure Management Portal to create a storage account.
trans-unit.target: You can use the Azure Management Portal to create a storage account.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: On the command bar, click **New**.
trans-unit.target: On the command bar, click **New**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Data Services** > **Storage** > **Quick Create**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Data Services** > **Storage** > **Quick Create**.

trans-unit.source: Quick create a storage account
trans-unit.target: Quick create a storage account

trans-unit.source: Fill out the fields as follows:
trans-unit.target: Fill out the fields as follows:

trans-unit.source: Under **URL**, type a subdomain name to use in the URL for the storage account.
trans-unit.target: Under **URL**, type a subdomain name to use in the URL for the storage account.

trans-unit.source: The entry can contain from 3-24 lowercase letters and numbers.
trans-unit.target: The entry can contain from 3-24 lowercase letters and numbers.

trans-unit.source: This name becomes the host name within the URL that is used to address Blob, Queue, or Table resources for the subscription.
trans-unit.target: This name becomes the host name within the URL that is used to address Blob, Queue, or Table resources for the subscription.

trans-unit.source: Choose the **location or affinity group** for the storage account.
trans-unit.target: Choose the **location or affinity group** for the storage account.

trans-unit.source: An affinity group lets you place your cloud services and storage in the same data center.
trans-unit.target: An affinity group lets you place your cloud services and storage in the same data center.

trans-unit.source: Decide whether to use **geo-replication** for the storage account.
trans-unit.target: Decide whether to use **geo-replication** for the storage account.

trans-unit.source: Geo-replication is turned on by default.
trans-unit.target: Geo-replication is turned on by default.

trans-unit.source: This option replicates your data to a secondary location, at no cost to you, so that your storage fails over to that location if a major failure occurs at the primary location.
trans-unit.target: This option replicates your data to a secondary location, at no cost to you, so that your storage fails over to that location if a major failure occurs at the primary location.

trans-unit.source: The secondary location is assigned automatically, and can't be changed.
trans-unit.target: The secondary location is assigned automatically, and can't be changed.

trans-unit.source: If you need more control over the location of your cloud-based storage due to legal requirements or organizational policy, you can turn off geo-replication.
trans-unit.target: If you need more control over the location of your cloud-based storage due to legal requirements or organizational policy, you can turn off geo-replication.

trans-unit.source: However, be aware that if you later turn on geo-replication, you will be charged a one-time data transfer fee to replicate your existing data to the secondary location.
trans-unit.target: However, be aware that if you later turn on geo-replication, you will be charged a one-time data transfer fee to replicate your existing data to the secondary location.

trans-unit.source: Storage services without geo-replication are offered at a discount.
trans-unit.target: Storage services without geo-replication are offered at a discount.

trans-unit.source: More details on managing geo-replication of Storage accounts can be found here: [Create, manage, or delete a storage account](../storage-create-storage-account/#replication-options).
trans-unit.target: More details on managing geo-replication of Storage accounts can be found here: [Create, manage, or delete a storage account](../storage-create-storage-account/#replication-options).

trans-unit.source: Enter storage account details
trans-unit.target: Enter storage account details

trans-unit.source: Click **Create Storage Account**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create Storage Account**.

trans-unit.source: The account now appears under **Storage**.
trans-unit.target: The account now appears under **Storage**.

trans-unit.source: Storage account successfully created
trans-unit.target: Storage account successfully created

trans-unit.source: Next, create a container for your uploaded VHDs.
trans-unit.target: Next, create a container for your uploaded VHDs.

trans-unit.source: Click the storage account name and then click **Containers**.
trans-unit.target: Click the storage account name and then click **Containers**.

trans-unit.source: Storage account detail
trans-unit.target: Storage account detail

trans-unit.source: Click **Create a Container**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create a Container**.

trans-unit.source: Storage account detail
trans-unit.target: Storage account detail

trans-unit.source: Type a **Name** for your container and select the **Access** policy.
trans-unit.target: Type a **Name** for your container and select the **Access** policy.

trans-unit.source: Container name
trans-unit.target: Container name

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] By default, the container is private and can be accessed only by the account owner.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] By default, the container is private and can be accessed only by the account owner.

trans-unit.source: To allow public read access to the blobs in the container, but not the container properties and metadata, use the "Public Blob" option.
trans-unit.target: To allow public read access to the blobs in the container, but not the container properties and metadata, use the "Public Blob" option.

trans-unit.source: To allow full public read access for the container and blobs, use the "Public Container" option.
trans-unit.target: To allow full public read access for the container and blobs, use the "Public Container" option.

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Prepare the connection to Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Prepare the connection to Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Before you can upload a .vhd file, you need to establish a secure connection between your computer and your subscription in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Before you can upload a .vhd file, you need to establish a secure connection between your computer and your subscription in Azure.

trans-unit.source: You can use the Microsoft Azure Active Directory method or the certificate method to do this.
trans-unit.target: You can use the Microsoft Azure Active Directory method or the certificate method to do this.

trans-unit.source: Use the Microsoft Azure AD method
trans-unit.target: Use the Microsoft Azure AD method

trans-unit.source: Open the Azure PowerShell console.
trans-unit.target: Open the Azure PowerShell console.

trans-unit.source: Type the following command:
trans-unit.target: Type the following command:

trans-unit.source: This command opens a sign-in window so you can sign with your work or school account.
trans-unit.target: This command opens a sign-in window so you can sign with your work or school account.

trans-unit.source: PowerShell Window
trans-unit.target: PowerShell Window

trans-unit.source: Azure authenticates and saves the credential information, and then closes the window.
trans-unit.target: Azure authenticates and saves the credential information, and then closes the window.

trans-unit.source: Use the certificate method
trans-unit.target: Use the certificate method

trans-unit.source: Open the Azure PowerShell console.
trans-unit.target: Open the Azure PowerShell console.

trans-unit.source: Type:
trans-unit.target: Type:

trans-unit.source: `Get-AzurePublishSettingsFile`.
trans-unit.target: `Get-AzurePublishSettingsFile`.

trans-unit.source: A browser window opens and prompts you to download a .publishsettings file.
trans-unit.target: A browser window opens and prompts you to download a .publishsettings file.

trans-unit.source: It contains information and a certificate for your Microsoft Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: It contains information and a certificate for your Microsoft Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: Browser download page
trans-unit.target: Browser download page

trans-unit.source: Save the .publishsettings file.
trans-unit.target: Save the .publishsettings file.

trans-unit.source: Type:
trans-unit.target: Type:

trans-unit.source: Where `<PathToFile>` is the full path to the .publishsettings file.
trans-unit.target: Where `<PathToFile>` is the full path to the .publishsettings file.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Get Started with Microsoft Azure Cmdlets](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/jj554332.aspx)
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Get Started with Microsoft Azure Cmdlets](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/jj554332.aspx)

trans-unit.source: For more information on installing and configuring PowerShell, see [How to install and configure Microsoft Azure PowerShell](../install-configure-powershell.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on installing and configuring PowerShell, see [How to install and configure Microsoft Azure PowerShell](../install-configure-powershell.md).

trans-unit.source: Step 4: Upload the .vhd file
trans-unit.target: Step 4: Upload the .vhd file

trans-unit.source: When you upload the .vhd file, you can place the .vhd file anywhere within your blob storage.
trans-unit.target: When you upload the .vhd file, you can place the .vhd file anywhere within your blob storage.

trans-unit.source: In the following command examples, **BlobStorageURL** is the URL for the storage account that you created in Step 2, **YourImagesFolder** is the container within blob storage where you want to store your images.
trans-unit.target: In the following command examples, **BlobStorageURL** is the URL for the storage account that you created in Step 2, **YourImagesFolder** is the container within blob storage where you want to store your images.

trans-unit.source: **VHDName** is the label that appears in the Management Portal to identify the virtual hard disk.
trans-unit.target: **VHDName** is the label that appears in the Management Portal to identify the virtual hard disk.

trans-unit.source: **PathToVHDFile** is the full path and name of the .vhd file.
trans-unit.target: **PathToVHDFile** is the full path and name of the .vhd file.

trans-unit.source: From the Azure PowerShell window you used in the previous step, type:
trans-unit.target: From the Azure PowerShell window you used in the previous step, type:

trans-unit.source: Step 5: Create a VM with uploaded VHD
trans-unit.target: Step 5: Create a VM with uploaded VHD

trans-unit.source: After you upload the .vhd, you can add it as an image to the list of custom images associated with your subscription and create a virtual machine with this custom image.
trans-unit.target: After you upload the .vhd, you can add it as an image to the list of custom images associated with your subscription and create a virtual machine with this custom image.

trans-unit.source: From the Azure PowerShell window you used in the previous step, type:
trans-unit.target: From the Azure PowerShell window you used in the previous step, type:

trans-unit.source: **Important**: Please use Linux as OS type for now since current Azure PowerShell version only accepts “Linux” or “Windows” as a parameter.
trans-unit.target: **Important**: Please use Linux as OS type for now since current Azure PowerShell version only accepts “Linux” or “Windows” as a parameter.

trans-unit.source: After you complete the previous steps, the new image is listed when you choose the **Images** tab on the Azure management portal.
trans-unit.target: After you complete the previous steps, the new image is listed when you choose the **Images** tab on the Azure management portal.

trans-unit.source: add image
trans-unit.target: add image

trans-unit.source: Create a virtual machine from gallery.
trans-unit.target: Create a virtual machine from gallery.

trans-unit.source: This new image is now available under **My Images**.
trans-unit.target: This new image is now available under **My Images**.

trans-unit.source: Select the new image and go through the prompts to set up a hostname, password/SSH key and etc.
trans-unit.target: Select the new image and go through the prompts to set up a hostname, password/SSH key and etc.

trans-unit.source: custom image
trans-unit.target: custom image

trans-unit.source: Once provisioning has completed, you will see your FreeBSD VM running in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Once provisioning has completed, you will see your FreeBSD VM running in Azure.

trans-unit.source: freebsd image in azure
trans-unit.target: freebsd image in azure
